alert.note: Alert for Thomas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued July 31 at 7:44AM EDT until July 31 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT /9 AM CDT/ THIS MORNING... ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON EDT /11 AM CDT/ TODAY TO 8 PM EDT /7 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. For the Heat Advisory, heat index values up to 109 expected. * WHERE...In Florida, Washington, Jackson, Inland Bay, Calhoun, Gadsden, Liberty and Coastal Bay Counties. In Georgia, Thomas County. * WHEN...For the Dense Fog Advisory, until 10 AM EDT /9 AM CDT/ this morning. For the Heat Advisory, from noon EDT /11 AM CDT/ today to 8 PM EDT /7 PM CDT/ this evening. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat illnesses to occur. Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Morning satellite and surface observations show areas of dense fog across parts of the Wiregrass Region, Southwest Georgia, and Florida Panhandle.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1. If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.
